bio: Pulitzer Prize-winning photographer & founder of @tooyoungtowed. I am also a Canon Explorer of Light. All photos ©Stephanie Sinclair.

list.comment: This week I had the opportunity to photograph the stunning @diandraforrest in the park with her son using a preproduction model from Canon’s brand new mirrorless system, the Canon EOS R. Working on a blog post to share more detailed thoughts but in short, looks like I’ll be adding another camera to my kit! @adorama @canonusa #EOSR #BeTheRevolution #exploreroflight #albinsim #portraits

Over the last two weeks, I had the opportunity to play a small part of this intensive story with New York Magazine @nymag about the the immigration polices as they are implemented in NYC and surrounding boroughs. Since her husband, Indra, - the sole family breadwinner - was taken into ICE detention 10 months ago, Risma Fadersair has been managing to care for her four children on her own. Two of the four are special needs, with autism and Down syndrome. I get nervous when Bryan leaves town for one week and I have to take care of my two on my own. I am humbled by her strength and determination. Kudos on NY Magazine and the Marshall Project for taking on this issue so thoroughly. See the full story here : https://nym.ag/2LtNo42

A young woman dries her hair after bathing at the Rescue Foundation's Mumbai home. Although illegal under Indian law, human trafficking remains a significant problem. According to @apneaap, a nonprofit which works to end sex-trafficking by preventing inter-generational prostitution in India, there are currently 16 million victims of sex trafficking in the country. India’s Lok Sabha passed the Trafficking of Persons (Prevention, Protection and Rehabilitation) Bill earlier this year, criminalizing and penalizing trafficking for exploitative sex, forced and bonded labor, begging, surrogacy and forced marriages. However, UN human rights experts say is must be revised with victim-centerd approach rather than criminalizing survivors, potentially further harming already vulnerable individuals. @canonusa #women #girls #trafficking #survivor #beauty #color #hope #change #canoncpsusa #canonexploreroflight

#sponsored by @OneSight // Newly bespectacled Gerlane, 14, is filled with joy as she travels by boat with her family back to her home in the Brazilian Amazon. Just weeks before, Gerlane lost her only pair of glasses down a well and was in a panic. Her father, a farmer, tried to fish the glasses out—to no avail; he later wept recalling the effort. This left Gerlane unable to do many things she loved, including reading to her sister at bedtime. Fortunately, her family heard about a mobile eye care clinic coming to a nearby village—an opportunity for a free eye exam and glasses—and made arrangements to travel there, an hour by boat. •
I was thrilled to join @OneSight, an independent nonprofit, as they hosted their first-ever, fully digital, eye clinic in the Amazon. More than 2,000 patients traveled to the clinic during a five-day boat expedition to bring better vision to a remote and underserved area. •
Today, on World Sight Day, I share this story in celebration of those who work to bring global attention to blindness and vision impairment and provide for those who lack access to vision care. // @OneSight found a way to reach them and provide more than clear sight. Watch for today’s story @natgeo and check out the link in my bio to learn more.

When your hero, the legendary #EugeneRichards, signs your photo book ❤️🙏😂 🕺If you are in or near NYC, don’t miss EUGENE RICHARDS: THE RUN-ON OF TIME, his retrospective at ICP through Jan 6, 2019. Thank you @kirstenlphotog for capturing this fun moment with Gene and @ryanchristopherjones !
Deep in the zone, our boy from Lanzhou devours noodles from home. #rainyday

Thrilled to have attended last night’s NYC premier of #FREESOLO ! It was truly epic and the panel following with film subjects Alex and Sanni, and directors @jimmy_chin and Chai was fascinating as well! If you want to be inspired and awed, Go See This Film. It follows free soloist climber Alex Honnold as he prepares to achieve his lifelong dream: climbing the face of the 3,200’ El Capitan in Yosemite National Park—without a rope. From award-winning documentary filmmaker Chai Vasarhelyi and world-renowned @natgeo photographer and mountaineer Jimmy Chin comes #FREESOLO, in theaters September 28th. Visit freesolofilm.com to buy tickets! @canonusa #badass #completelyinsane #followyourpassion

Posting the #FREESOLO trailer because it’s bananas. And awesome.

Baby Seibureh, 17, and Claude Seibureh, 48, of Freetown, were married during the Ebola crisis. Because of her small stature, Baby needed a cesarean section to safely give birth to their son, Joseph. While child marriage is a critical issue in both crisis and stable contexts, the rates of girls married underage is rising at alarming rates in humanitarian settings according to Girls Not Brides. •

Today is the 7th annual International Day of the Girl Child. In honor of this important day, I collaborated with my friend, fellow photojournalist and AP photo editor @mayaalleruzzo MayaAlleruzzo on a story she published titled, “AP PHOTOS: Growing up Female Across the Globe.” Poverty, violence, and cultural traditions oppress millions of girls in every part of the world. It is still a global struggle to have girls valued for more than their bodies — for just their sexuality, fertility and labor. Today we come together to help galvanize support and inspire the international community to do its part to establish, expand and protect girls’ rights so girls are free to determine the course of their own lives. It’s also a time to celebrate girls in every way, which is long overdue. To learn more please visit my nonprofit organization’s website at tooyoungtowed.org. @tooyoungtowed #IDG2018 #tooyoungtowed #endchildmarriage #canonusa #canonexploreroflight @canonusa
